intro: Askellia nana, commonly known as the dwarf askellia, is a small, herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are typically ovate to elliptical in shape. Its flowers are small and usually pale yellow or white, arranged in clusters. Askellia nana is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its compact size and delicate appearance.
